availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Dunn Gilmore (Marion County, Kentucky, hotel keeper and trader)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, hotel keeper and trader. Mississippi native. Married to Margaret Fitzpatrick Gilmore in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on June 13, 1854. Father of William W. Gilmore and George F. Gilmore. Owned at least two enslaved persons, including Elijah, in Pulaski County, Kentucky, in 1854. Owned at least one enslaved person, including Peggy, in 1857. Hotel Keeper in Marion County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860. Household owned an additional nine enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860. Trader in Marion County in 1863.
